intro: Henriettella ciliata, commonly known as the silky henriettella, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, delicate flowers with four petals. Its leaves are often covered in fine, hair-like structures, giving it a silky appearance. Henriettella ciliata is typically found in moist, high-altitude habitats and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native region.
